title: Drawing, "Design for Embroidery: Po", 1780–90
medium: Graphite, brush and gouache on laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in ink, upper right: P 1734 / S. R.
provenance: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1920: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Rectangular corner; three buttonholes. Two fantastical peacocks prey for insects. Plants, festoons. A bunch of flowers decorates the oblong pocket, a fantastical tree stands beside its left side. On verso: five yellow birds with leaves rising from two of them.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Embroidery: Po", 1780–90.Graphite, brush and gouache on laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1920-36-83.
